poem:
Icons on the Floor

Dancing stars  
dressed in dreams—  
Cher, Spice, Céline  
whirl & sparkle,  
borrowed light  
filling the stage,  
a fragile grace.  

Watch them,  
each step a prayer  
for praise,  
a twirl  
to grasp the night's  
elusive ten—  
caught briefly,  
an echo  
of borrowed fame.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "TV tonight: a dazzling night of Strictly stars taking on their favourite icons Strictly Come Dancing 6.20pm, BBC One La Voix taking on Cher! Ellie becoming a Spice Girl! Karen giving it her best Céline Dion! It’s Claudia’s favourite stage of the competition – icons week – and the remaining celebrities are ready to dance to their favourite stars. Will anybody be able to join Alex in getting an “early Shirley 10”? It’s going to". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
